title: New bus services for residents in Clyde and Clyde North
articleContent:
From Sunday 28 March 2021, two new bus routes will connect residents in Clyde and Clyde North with Berwick Station and increase the number of bus services along Clyde Road. The new services provide new options for accessing shops, healthcare services, schools, and higher education and training institutions.

It will now be easier for residents to get to important destinations such as Eden Rise Village Shopping Centre, Berwick station, Federation University Australia, the Chisholm Institute, St Francis Xavier College, St Catherine’s Catholic Primary School, and Rivercrest Christian school. The bus services pass close to Berwick Healthcare and Casey Hospital.

Route 888 Clyde – Berwick Station travels from the terminus at Pattersons and Berwick-Cranbourne roads, runs along Berwick-Cranbourne Road and Clyde Road to terminate at Berwick Station. It travels the same journey in reverse. The new timetable is available now.

Bus Route 889 Clyde North – Berwick Station via Grices Road travels from the terminus at Ferdinand Drive and Skylark Boulevard and runs via Skylark Boulevard, Soldiers Road, Grices Road and Clyde Road to terminate at Berwick Station. It travels the same journey in reverse. The new timetable is available now.

To plan your journey view the new timetables for Route 888 and Route 889, visit Journey planner or call 1800 800 007 to order a printed copy of your timetable.
